org.streaminer.stream.model

Class SlidingWindow<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.streaminer.stream.model.SlidingWindow<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - any kind of object
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class SlidingWindow<T>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class offers a easy to use sliding window implementation. The size of the window is fixed and can't be modified after initialing the SlidingWindow. You can insert elements of the same type of objects into the window. This objects may vary in size (e.g. if you want to save space by adding only new elements to the window whose values vary at least a given threshold, you would add some kind of summary for all the elements that can be covered using one value. In this case the element's size would be total number of elements that fall into the summary).
    Because of moving the borders is left to the user this implementation can be used for managing windows that age per time unit as well as per seen element.
    Author:
    Markus Kokott
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(T element)
        Adds a new element to the window. The size of this elements is the default size (i.e. 1).
        Please note, that no older elements will be discarded until you slide the window manually!
        Parameters:
        element -

      • add

        public void add(T element,
       Integer size)
        Adds a new element to the window. The size of this element is specified by the user.
        Please note, that no older elements will be discarded until you slide the window manually!
        Parameters:
        element -
        size - - Integer value that specifies the elements size
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if size is greater than windowSize or a negative Integer

      • slideWindowByOnePosition

        public void slideWindowByOnePosition()
        Just moves the border of the window by one position.

      • slideWindow

        public void slideWindow(Integer positions)
        Moves the window a given number of positions.
        Parameters:
        positions - - a Integer value representing the elapsed "time"
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if positions is a negative value

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks whether the SlidingWindow is empty
        Returns:
